prompt: <description>Part 1 - A Simple, Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. These settings will define the orientation and position of the part. Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch Now, create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system that you just set up. In this sketch, we will create a rectangle: 1. Create the first line (line\_1) from the point [0.0, 0.0] to [0.0285, 0.0]. 2. Create the second line (line\_2) from the point [0.0285, 0.0] to [0.0285, 0.0122]. 3. Create the third line (line\_3) from the point [0.0285, 0.0122] to [0.0, 0.0122]. 4. Create the fourth line (line\_4) from the point [0.0, 0.0122] to [0.0, 0.0]. Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the entire sketch using a factor of 0.0285 (sketch\_scale). This will make the part dimensions 0.0285 units in length and width, and 0.75 units in height. Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketch Convert the 2D sketch into a 3D solid by extruding it through the Z-axis. Set the extrude depth towards the normal (extrude\_depth\_towards\_normal) to 0.75 units, making the overall height of the part 0.75 units. The extrude depth towards the opposite normal (extrude\_depth\_opposite\_normal) will be 0.0 units, which means the part will have a flat top and bottom. This will result in the creation of a simple, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. **Part 1 dimensions:** * Length: 0.0285 units * Width: 0.75 units * Height: 0.0285 units (top and bottom) and 0.75 units (total)</description>
